CHAT.comment: diary for nina30: nina is very excited because she will be going to a birthday party for her friend ari in the afternoon. he will be one year old. nina loves to play with him and his two older sisters Becca and rachel nina is playing with some colored wooden blocks of all different shapes.

u.a: nina has seen some of the houses in carmel which her mother calls castles for the rich .
mother points to a king and queen puppet that are hanging on nina's wall .
nina knocks over the blocks that she used to build the castle .
mother takes a king puppet off the wall . he has a beard .
nina points to the queen puppet that is still hanging on the wall .
mother puts the puppet inside the castle that nina has built .
mother takes the queen puppet off the wall .
nina points to the body of a third puppet that is still attached to the wall . the head is missing .
the king and queen are hand puppets .
mother puts one of the puppets on her hand . the head falls off . the head of the puppets is a round rubber ball that becomes detached from the body very easily .
mother puts the head back on the puppet and makes sure that the head on both the king and queen puppet are on securely .
nina points to the king and queen .
"build" mispronounced .
nina picks up the queen puppet .
nina touches the robe of the king .
"velvet" is mispronounced .
nina wants mother to pat the queen's dress .
nina mispronounces "material ."
the king puppet's head falls off again .
the king has a bald spot in the middle of his head .
the king's head keeps falling off .
nina makes a bed out of blocks .
nina puts the king on the bed that she has built out of blocks . she covers the king with a kleenex that she pretends is a blanket .
nina points to the queen .
nina uses folded pieces of kleenex for a pillow . she wants mother to put the queen puppet on the bed she has made .
the pillow has fallen off the bed made out of blocks .
nina points to the body of another puppet still attached to the wall .

mother opens up a package full of small wooden pieces of houses , fences , cars , and many other things which one can use to build a village . there are also many small wooden animals . nina becomes very excited when she sees this new toy .
nina dumps all the pieces on the floor . she picks up a small wooden cat .
mother is looking at many different parts of houses . nina starts building a house .
nina is holding a long rectangular block in the shape of a bell tower with a clock drawn on it .
mother picks up another block in the shape of a church .
mother puts two bell towers on either side of the church .
nina picks up a small wooden cow .
mother starts setting up fences to mark off a pasture .
mother places lots_of small wooden animals inside the fenced off area .
nina picks up some little cards which show pictures of the many different ways that one can put the blocks together to build different villages .
mother points to a card showing a pasture full of animals .
nina starts taking various pieces out of the box .
nina makes a long drawn out noise of a car .
nina wants to play with the pieces of fence .
"village" mispronounced .
nina starts jabbering in the middle of the last sentence .
mother puts some wooden animals inside a fenced in area .
nina thinks that the small wooden man looks like a tree . mother takes a tree out of the box .
nina plays with the various wooden animals .
mother constructs fences out of long pieces of wood that fit into small holes in square pieces that hold them together .
nina is trying to push the long thin stick into a hole of the square piece .
nina is holding a thin stick . mother hands nina a square piece with holes in it .
mother and nina complete one fence .
nina picks up a small wooden car .
nina is pushing some wooden cars around on her floor .
nina is talking about the small wooden man .
mother completes a fenced in area .
nina starts putting the wooden animals in the enclosed area .
nina starts coughing .
mother constructs an enclosed area out of blocks .
mother builds some houses putting different colored roofs on each one .
nina takes out various vehicles .
mother has put two parts of a truck one behind the next .
"together" mispronounced .
nina is referring to the wagon of the truck .
last two sentences not clear . mother is building a fence again .
nina takes the cow from her mother .
mother takes out some small wooden trees .
nina picks up the cards again which illustrate the different villages that one can build with the components of the box .
mother points to one of the cards as she asks the next questions .
mother points to the houses that they have set up on the floor . nina starts mumbling .
nina points to the smoke stacks on top of a little wooden train .
mother starts picking up some wooden animals .
last sentence not clear .
mother points out the goat's horn to nina .
nina yells .
mother hands the animals to nina .
the enclosure is very small so the animals have to be piled on top of each other .
mother points to the spaces between the houses .
mother laughs .
mother makes the car weave around the houses .
mother starts setting up trees on large flat box top .
nina yells last sentence .
nina is looking at a fat wooden lady .
"hippopotamus" mispronounced .
mother laughs .
nina busys herself taking various things out of the box and setting them up .
mother sets up another train .
mother sets up some blocks in the shape of a railroad station .
mother sets up a conductor near the station .
last sentence not clear .
mother hands nina a wooden piece in the shape of a roof .
last sentence not clear .
mother places the conductor on top of the train .
nina touches the coal that is carved out of wood in the train wagon .
mother fixes the train wheel .
nina starts making train noises as she pushes the train around .
nina tries to detach the roof from the station which is attached .
mother removes the roof from one of the houses .
mother takes out a clown and some circus horses that can perform various acrobatic tricks when drawn to a magnet .
"magnet" mispronounced .
mother draws the horse towards the magnet .
mother attaches the clown to the magnet .
the clown is hanging from the magnet by his feet .
nina picks up another clown .
mother laughs as she picks up a circus ring and makes it move with the magnet .
nina tries to attract a wooden block to the magnet .
nina starts playing with the village again .
nina is looking for her two hand puppets again .
mother points to the puppets lying down on some blocks .
we had gone to visit them about a month ago on the train . elijah and nicholas are two little boys . Chantal is their mother . they live in santa barbara .
"Elijah" is frequently called "Lijah ."
"teddy" mispronounced . Nina and her mother have bought a teddy bear for Ari for his birthday .
mother takes out some blue wrapping paper .
mother puts the teddy bear in a plastic bag .
nina takes the teddy bear and hugs him .
mother starts wrapping up the teddy bear in blue paper .
mother wraps many sheets of blue tissue paper around the teddy bear .
nina holds the scotch tape .
mother cuts off a piece of scotch tape . it catches on a piece of tissue paper .
mother turns the teddy bear over and wraps it on the other side .
nina is looking at the small paper figure of a little man whose arm has been torn off .
mother places a small black horse in the village .
nina picks up the paper man .
nina looks for her book about the seasons .
nina opens the book about the seasons to a picture of a snowman .
nina points to a girl .
there a several boys and girls making the snowman together .
the children in the picture are all bundled up because of the winter weather .
the children in the picture are wearing scarfs around their necks .
mother points to the little girl in the picture that nina identified with .
nina points to this swimming pool as she says the last sentence .
nina and her mother are still looking at the book about the seasons . they are looking a picture of a little girl in a plastic swimming pool on her lawn .
gail is a baby-sitter of nina's . nina had fallen into her large swimming pool several months ago .
nina loves slides and there was one leading into gail's swimming pool . nina had gone down it no realizing she would end up in the water .
mother laughs .
nina makes a funny face .
mother had just attached a height chart on nina's wall with animals , children and other decorations drawn at the sides .
nina becomes interested in playing with the village again .
"horse" mispronounced .
she points to the trees that had already been set up to form a forest .
mother picks up a small plastic horse .
mother reattaches him .
the horse became detached from the magnet and fell off .
mother laughs at nina's answer .
mother sets the small train upright in the village . nina makes train noises .
nina sees a bunch of blue tissue paper left over from the paper mother had used to wrap Ari's birthday present . she thinks it is another present .
nina sees a pink donkey that her mother has just bought for her .
nina is playing with the donkey's harness .
nina is still trying to get the harness off the donkey .
mother is talking about the donkey's eyes .
mother take out a skirt , blouse , and apron .
nina points to the apron .
last sentence not clear .
mother lifts nina onto the changing table in order to put on a clean diaper .
nina had celebrated her second birthday with two friends , leila , and her baby sister , ronnie . there had been an enormous birthday cake .
mother is still in the process of changing nina on the dressing table .
nina starts singing .
Becca is Ari's sister . ellie is his mother .
rachel is Becca's and Ari's older sister .
nina yells next sentence . she is excited about the party .
nina points to her skirt . it is a full skirt similar to the ones her mother wears to go folk dancing in every week .
"suspenders" and "don't" mispronounced .
the waist of the skirt is too big for nina . the skirt starts to fall off when she takes a step forward .
nina starts dancing around and resisting her mother's attempts to put on suspenders .
"don't" and "suspenders" not pronounced clearly .
nina does not finish the last word .
mother holds up a pretty green blouse with flowers on it .
mother puts on nina's suspenders .
nina wants to snap shut the suspenders .
nina managed to snap the suspender shut .
last sentence not clear .
mother looks in nina's closet for another dress since the blouse fits nina rather snugly . she changes her mind and decides to leave nina in the clothes she has on .
nina points to the clothes she has on .
last two sentences not clear .
nina picks up the apron .
nina and her mother have started referring to Ari's birthday party as Becca's party .
nina sees a nail on the ground .
last two sentences not clear .
nina starts jabbering nonsense at the end of the last sentence .
nina says "meself" rather than "myself ."
nina had fallen down when she was with her baby-sitter , gail .
nina starts to pull on her tights . the band-aid on her ankle comes off .
mother stuffs some cotton in the toes of the black shoes to Make them fit nina's feet better .
mother holds the black shoes up against the brown ones .
mother kisses nina's feet .
nina puts the black shoes on her hands and starts clapping her hands together .
mister wood , our neighbor had punched some extra holes in the shoe's strap .
mister wood had Made the extra holes by hammering a hole with a nail .
the woods , our neighbors , baby sat for nina last night . she had gone to sleep at their house in a big bed .
mother tries to slip nina's black shoe on without unbuckling the strap .
david is Ari's father .
nina starts to cry . she hates to have her hair brushed .
nina continues protesting loudly . her next four sentences are hard to make out .
nina protests violently as mother tries to brush her hair .
mother laughs .
nina has had her bangs cut recently .
nina wants to get off the dressing table where she has been while mother was dressing her .
nina picks up some animals .
mother takes out a story book about a frisky puppy that gets into everything .
the dog in the picture had jumped on a house built out of blocks and knocked it over .
"licking" not pronounced clearly . the dog in the picture is licking a toy house .
last sentence not clear .
the mother is waving her arms in the air trying to make the dog scram .
the mother has a happy expression on her face because the dog is under the carriage .
nina turns to the next page of the book .
the ice-cream Man is feeding the dog an ice-cream cone .
"groceries" mispronounced .
"store" mispronounced . the dog in the picture is actually entering a bus .
nina mumbles . her words are hard to distinguish .
there is a red traffic light in the picture . nina has just learned about traffic lights .
nina is trying to get the harness off her stuffed donkey .
nina starts jabbering at the end of the last sentence .
